text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Egypt warns of the risks to regional security from Israel's growing arsenal of weapons. Foreign Minister Amr Moussa, giving Egypt's speech to the U.N. General Assembly, said the region has been, and still is, in a crisis that has nearly destroyed the peace process.

- The economic summit expected to be held in Cairo in November will include 85 countries and 25 organisations. Ambassador Ahmed Abul Khair, assistant general coordinator, said Egypt would present 52 projects with total investment costs of $16 billion.
- Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid, before leaving for Washington, said that 3,500 international financial figures would be invited to participate in the Cairo economic summit.
- Winter time starts in midnight on Thursday.
- Industry Minister Suleiman Reda said three decisions would be implemented to facilitate setting up industrial projects.
- Emergency procedures to be taken by a committee of irrigation and archaeology experts to protect archaeological sites from floods.
- Former chairman of the Holding Company for Engineering Industries is remanded 15 days for questioning over suspicions he has taken $35 million in bribes.
